docs.snippet: Ukraine's SBU security service says illegal military groups from Moldova's breakaway Transdniestria region worked with Russian groups to stir up unrest in the Ukrainian Black Sea city of Odessa, where dozens died in clashes on Friday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Ukraine's SBU security service says illegal military groups from Moldova's breakaway Transdniestria region worked with Russian groups to stir up unrest in the Ukrainian Black Sea city of Odessa, where dozens died in clashes on Friday.

headline.main: Factbox: Ukraine Says Groups From Moldova's Transdniestria Stir Unrest in Odessa
headline.print_headline: Factbox: Ukraine Says Groups From Moldova's Transdniestria Stir Unrest in Odessa

docs.snippet: The beauty of this surprise all-Madrid Champions League final is that Atlético’s players and their coach genuinely and legitimately believe that they have a chance....
docs.lead_paragraph: The beauty of this surprise all-Madrid Champions League final is that Atlético’s players and their coach genuinely and legitimately believe that they have a chance.
docs.abstract: Christopher Clarey On Soccer column examines Champions League final matchup between Real Madrid and Atletico Madrid; notes that Atletico has a budget roughly one quarter the size of Real, and that it is seeking its first championship while Real has won 9; holds beauty of matchup is that Atletico legitimately believes it has a chance to win against powerhouse.

headline.main: In Champions League Final, a Battle for the Hearts of Madrid

docs.snippet: Manchester City boss Manuel Pellegrini warned his side not to take their eye off the ball despite a 3-2 victory at Everton on Saturday that put them in reach of the Premier League title....
docs.lead_paragraph: Manchester City boss Manuel Pellegrini warned his side not to take their eye off the ball despite a 3-2 victory at Everton on Saturday that put them in reach of the Premier League title.

headline.print_headline: Nothing Decided Yet Says Man City's Pellegrini

docs.snippet: James Naismith had strong feelings against segregation and was a mentor to a student who became the first black coach in professional basketball....
docs.lead_paragraph: James Naismith had strong feelings against segregation and was a mentor to a student who became the first black coach in professional basketball.
docs.abstract: The Upshot; controversy surrounding comments by Los Angeles Clippers owner Donald Sterling presents opportunity to remember that James Naismith, Canadian who invented basketball, had strong feelings against segregation and about role of race and money in the sport; Naismith was also a mentor to John McLendon, who became first black coach in professional basketball.

headline.main: Naismith’s Choices on Race, From Basketball’s Beginnings
headline.print_headline: A Sport’s Founder on Race Matters

docs.snippet: A relatively minor leak last year has led regulators in Alberta to re-examine production that uses steam under pressure to separate oil from subterranean sands....
docs.lead_paragraph: A relatively minor leak last year has led regulators in Alberta to re-examine production that uses steam under pressure to separate oil from subterranean sands.
docs.abstract: Relatively minor oil leak in 2013 is leading regulators in Alberta, Canada, to re-examine production that uses steam under pressure to separate oil from subterranean sands; Alberta Energy Regulator officials have refused to accept explanations for cause of accident by field operator Canadian Natural Resources; agency has also rejected company’s bid to restart its operation until complete investigation had been completed.

headline.main: Accident Leads to Scrutiny of Oil Sand Production
headline.print_headline: Accident Leads to Scrutiny of Oil Sand Production
